Latter Days is a very, VERY independent movie. And compared to many of today's more modern films, it's lacking on many parts. The shooting budget was very cheap and the acting is rather stifled by the intense Christian messages scattered throughout the film. The sets are looking more like a low-budget TV show rather than a decent romantic comedy one would expect. But the story itself was very good and compelling. I guess that's why I expected more of the film.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form a posse to destroy the animal, and things seem to be just fine. Well, until they find that one cat has been turned into an unstoppable killing machine, and is ripping its way through the town.
